Get Size Properties of an Object

Source: R/size.R
size.Rd

ndim(x) is short-hand for length(dim(x)).

s(x, m) gets the size of an object x along margin m.
If m == 0, s() gets the length of an object.
If m > 0, s() gets dim(x)[m] of the object.

Usage

ndim(x)

rdim(x)

s(x, ...)

# Default S3 method
s(x, m = if (is.null(dim(x))) 0L else dim(x), ...)

Arguments

x

a vector, array, or data.frame.

...

further arguments passed to or from methods.

m

the margin.

Value

For ndim():
An integer, giving the number of dimensions x has.
For vectors, gives 0L.

For rdim():
An integer vector, giving the range 1:ndim(x).
For vectors, gives 0L.

For s():
A numeric vector giving the size(s) of the object at the given margin(s).

Examples

x <- 1:10
ndim(x)
#> [1] 0
obj <- array(1:64, c(4,4,3))
print(obj)
#> , , 1
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    5    9   13
#> [2,]    2    6   10   14
#> [3,]    3    7   11   15
#> [4,]    4    8   12   16
#> 
#> , , 2
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]   17   21   25   29
#> [2,]   18   22   26   30
#> [3,]   19   23   27   31
#> [4,]   20   24   28   32
#> 
#> , , 3
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]   33   37   41   45
#> [2,]   34   38   42   46
#> [3,]   35   39   43   47
#> [4,]   36   40   44   48
#> 
ndim(obj)
#> [1] 3
